page.title: 12CUSTOMS IN CHURCH MINSHULL
page.content: Customs and traditions have evolved from the Church. In January the farmers of the parish attend the annual{Blessing of the {Plough Service.}In August St. Bartholemew's Day is celebrated by a gift evening, when every house- hold in the parish is asked to make a contribution toward the upkeep of the Church. In October, the{Harvest {Festival}is held to give thanks for the year's harvest. In addition to the Sunday services Evensong is said the preceding Friday. Gifts of produce are distributed to the sick and elderly. At{Christmas}time a traditional carol service of nine lessons and carols is held and every house in the parish is visited by carol singers. At this time the Vicar and wardens dispense {charity money}to the poor of the parish.
